items.questionText: What is the SI unit of force?
items.explanation: The newton (symbol: N) is the SI unit of force, named after Sir Isaac Newton.

items.questionText: Which of these is a scalar quantity?
items.explanation: Scalar quantities have only magnitude, not direction. Energy is a scalar; the others are vectors.

items.questionText: Did you know? Light travels at approximately 300,000 km/s.
items.explanation: This is a display‑only fact – no answer required.

items.questionText: In which year did World War II end?
items.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Germany in May and Japan in September.

items.questionText: The Cold War was primarily between which two superpowers?
items.explanation: The Cold War (1947–1991) was a geopolitical tension between the United States and the Soviet Union.
